file_content.text: A pleasure helping you, my lord.
It's a shot in the dark, but hopefully one of the Gormak shamans is a dream-walker too and can help you.
I've been studying the Voss for twenty years, and I think I understood two words.
The Nightmare Lands I understand, but you need to find a dream-walking Gormak and activate a dream-rock, in order to fight nightmares?
It doesn't matter if you understand it. Can you help me?
That's about right.
Don't forget the part where the nightmares turn to flesh and blood.
It's even crazier than that.
Yes, of course.
Did I tell you I swam in toxic waste once?
This is nothing.
Um, no, you left that out, too.
Look, I'm sorry. I can't wrap my head around this. A dream-walking, nightmare-fighting Gormak?
What would that be? A Gormak that can use the Force? I don't know what you're trying to do, let alone where to find one that can do it.
My understanding is that dream-walking is a Force ritual. Does that help?
We need a Force-using Gormak.
Not much.
Surely something like this must've come up in your research.
Look through all those files.
My research is on Voss society, not on crazy ancient rituals given out by ghosts in hidden libraries!
What good are you then?
You're useless.
Here's what I can tell you. The Gormak hate the Voss, and they absolutely do not use the Force.
They refer to Voss Mystics as "nightmares," and the closest things they have to Mystics, socially, are their shamans. End chapter, end book.
What do you mean the shamans are like the Mystics, socially?
About these shamans....
Just that. They don't have the special abilities of the Mystics, but they're sort of spiritual leaders. Wait, what's this?
These shamans don't have any special abilities? Strange practices?
No Force users at all?
Not that I'm aware. No. Wait.
There must be another way to find what I need.
We need a different approach.
I don't know what that could be. Wait.
There is one obscure Gormak legend of a shaman who visited strange places in his sleep....
It's a shot in the dark, but the shamans have a meeting-stone deep in Gormak lands. Perhaps if you dream-walk nearby, you may locate a fellow walker.
I'm sorry I can't help you more, my lord. This Force business is, no offense, insane.
What have you done? You can't just kill a Voss!
Do you know how hard the Empire has worked to keep these people on friendly terms?
We need to clean this up before anyone comes looking for them. And you'd better hope no one saw them coming here.
Toss them outside and let the wild animals gnaw on them. Let the Voss believe they were mauled.
Make it look like an accident.
Yes, my lord. Let's just hope nobody notices the burn marks on their clothes.
Set them on fire. Better that no one finds any evidence.
Destroy the bodies.
As you say, my lord. Let's just hope no one comes around here asking questions.
I need to find a Gormak for this ritual....
Forget the bodies.
Fine, I'll have the bodies tossed in the garbage, I guess. Tell me about this Gormak you need....
You did not turn back. This is your second warning.
Safe journey.
I hope your journey is safe and pleasant as well.
A good day to you, too.
The shuttle master expects you.
You do not attack my power base and then wish me "safe journey."
Here's my reply. [Attack.]
You have no power base on Voss.
Go away, and do not attack my servants again.
Get out of here.
Leave and we will not attack.
Thank you, my lord. What a mess. It looks like their bark was worse than their bite. They haven't broken much.
Now, how's the ritual coming along? Have you discovered what you need to do?
I need to find a Gormak....
I believe I'm close.
I'm not really sure, actually. Something about a Gormak....
It's hard to describe.
I spoke to a ghost in the Shrine of Healing who told me I needed to find a Gormak....
There was a ghost....
Tell me what you can....
My lord! The Voss are trying to force me off the planet.
Their commandos are destroying my research. All because I helped you.
I don't wish to cause anymore trouble than necessary. Try to appease them until I get there.
Keep them calm.
I need to know where to find a Gormak that can dream-walk.
I don't have time.
A what? Oh, never mind. I won't be able to tell you anything if they destroy my research.
Hang on tight.
Thank you, my lord.
That's twenty years of my life! Get your hands off--!
Find the dream-walkers. They'll be able to help you better than I can.
I've told you, Jophen, the concept of diplomacy itself is strange to the Voss.
As far as they are concerned, they are the only people who matter. They receive the visions, not the Empire.
And not the Republic!
And not the Republic. The point is, there's no precedent for what you're asking in Voss culture.
Ah, my lord! Rul Jophen, Imperial Diplomatic Service. A pleasure.
Try not to stir the pot too much while you're here. When the chips fall, we want the Voss to land with us--you understand, of course?
I will be on my best behavior, I promise.
Completely.
Then I'll be sure to blame all my trespasses on the Republic.
They'll never know it was me.
Heh. Not a bad idea. Of course, better be sure the Mystics haven't had a vision of it first.
If they give me what I want, you have nothing to fear.
I make no promises.
That's exactly what I'm afraid of.
Thank you, Mistress Kallis. Again, my lord, a pleasure.
My lord. Good to see the rumors of your death are just that. But why Voss? Don't you have a Dark Council member to kill?
I heard the Voss know a ritual that can heal a fractured mind....
I'm after a healing ritual.
It seems my plan to kill Thanaton has hit a little roadblock....
I'm having a little trouble.
With great power comes a lot of nagging, apparently.
I hear loud, annoying ghosts.
I'm listening....
So, you're after a healing ritual that can keep these, um, ghosts under your control.
In all my time studying the Voss, I don't think I've ever encountered such a ritual. Although... let me look something up.
Take your time.
I'm patient.
Ah, here we go.
I have all the time in the world for a lovely lady.
[Flirt] Certainly.
Thank you, but I'm married. Happily married.
Hurry up.
I can't help but notice your complexion.
So, you're pure-blooded Sith?
I'm one of the few Sith-blooded Imperials with no Force sensitivity. But the Voss like color, so it's not a total loss.
Let's see. Of the two kinds of Mystics in Voss society--the visionaries and the healers--both are extremely rare.
But rarer still is a small Mystic sub-sect--outcasts who call themselves the dream-walkers.
I understand outsiders. We shall have common ground.
I'll go see these outcasts.
What exactly are these dream-walkers?
Dream-walkers?
They apparently use an odd combination of healing and visionary techniques. They're not entirely embraced by Voss society.
I will find them and force them to find a cure.
They will do as I command.
The Diplomatic Service will not appreciate it if you're too forceful, my lord.
They spend most of their time meditating in an enclave below Voss-Ka. Like all Voss, they're cagey around outsiders, but perhaps you can persuade them to help you.
I'm sorry, I'm busy at the moment.
My lord. Good to see the rumors of your death are just that. But why Voss? Don't you have a Darth to kill?
